Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff - overall a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mum2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4nights last week with our 6 year old - securing a rate of €116 room only per night (booked online). The room was a good size, clean and the bed was really comfortable. The hotel provided an extra bed for our son, again this was comfortable. Without asking they also supplied additional towels. The room comes with a mini-bar and there is room to store some drinks/items of your own. We had breakfast in the hotel on our last day (the other days we wanted to get out and explore as soon as we got up) - the food was excellent with a great choice. Again the staff were helpful and accommodating. The hotel is ideally located - a short walk from the metro, bus and tram and ideally placed for the FC Barcelona Nou Camp stadium. The front desk were extremely helpful and knowledgeable and pointed us in the right direction on each occasion. They also provided excellent recommendations for local restaurants. All in all a great stay and the hotel is highly recommended. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and stay”
Reviews.Author: JernB
Reviews.Content: Having stayed four nights at Hesperia Presidente to explore Barcelona with the family I can really recommend this hotel. It's only a 20 minute walk from La Sagrada Familia, the old town, Ramblas... Also there are plenty of busses running outside the hotel to all parts of the town, and taxi is cheap. As other reviewers have pointed out - the bathroom isn't very private, but traveling with the family this was a problem for us. The breakfast was super. Lots of different choices form fruit to pastries. Don't forgett to ask for their great scrambled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Irfan I
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant experience.. The only concern was the shower which was not too private and hence was not suitable if I had been with a colleague. AC was not functioning as it just threw warm air despite hot weather during day time. In the end I would say it's a very nice hotel despite having some minuses but still a good investment if you planning a short stay in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Spicy shower!”
Reviews.Author: georgebird
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews. Pretty good location. Checked in in the evening and out in the morning, and didn't require or use most of the amenities. Free Wifi is nice. Nice sitting area and view. Good customer service. Warning: In our room the shower was adjacent to the bedroom, and was separated by transparent and opaque tiles in such a way that the shower wasn't private. If you are sharing a room with somebody you don't want to see in the shower, this might not be the place for you. Also, the door to the toilet was opaque glass that didn't quite close all the way, so if you are a stickler for privacy while on the john you might have a problem. It's also a little pricey, but seemed on par with the cost of other hotels. If arriving from BCN airport, you can take RENFE train to Estacion Sants and transfer to the 27 bus. Quick and easy trip from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dumid
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review right from the Hesperia hotel. This is part of the NH chain and is considered 4 stars. I will start with the positive points: Very fast check-in, very nice appointed room with sitting area, nice LCD, free wireless internet everywhere, very clean, room big enough, comfy bed, very well located in the middle of the shopping area, very varied, tasty breakfast. Negative points: A little outdated, in need of refurbishment, I would tend to say it is a good 3+ stars A little pricey for the comfort offered (paid 150 e for single use) No pay per view channels on the tv, noisy heating, internet not stable, poor choice on the minibar, no bathtub but shower. All in all I can recommend it, though the price is not justified.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Brusselsdude
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to find this hotel as it was at (literally) the last minute. We had booked a B&B around the corner, only to find upon arrival that it did not exist. After an hour of walking around, late at night, the Hesperia Presidente was suggested to us. Luckily they had a room available for us. The rooms are spotless and spacious. The only complaint I would make is that the toilet door is made of foggy glass, therefore I could hear exactly what my friend was doing in there! other than that, we had no problems. The breakfast is terrific, with a wide varity of things to choose from. The staff were always helpful and kind. Although the hotel is not in the centre, you can easily get there by taking the regular buses. You may also take the tourist Hop on/Hop off buses as there is a stop just around the corner. All in all we had a very pleasant time at the Hesperia Presidente and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay good value”
Reviews.Author: Ismamart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days rooms were clean comfortable bed the bathroom was good size be comfortable with your roommates because you can see people shower from the main room. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel and the metro stop is about 10 min walk plenty of restaurants around the area and no more than 15 min from the main action in las ramblas. Staff was helpful and multilingual

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cmsurvivor
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. I will go back if ever I return to Barcelona. It is situated in a lovely area. The food at breakfast was very good. The rooms were beautiful and clean. We had a problem with the safe as it was not working. To make up for it, the hotel gave us free breakfasts and a room upgrade. The staff was so pleasant and helpful. The price was very affordable. Near the hotel you will find many cafes and boutiques. We were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and offers great value for money. The staff is very friendly and helpful, they collected a beautiful breakfast tray for my sick friend when I only asked if I could take some breakfast for him. WIll definitely consider staying there again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: jaychenkuo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for business and it was a good, reasonable hotel that's a quick stroll to the subway for where ever you want to go in the city. The bed was comfortable and for business I didn't really need much of the amenities. The sink wouldn't drain when I first got there but a quick call solved the problem; although the handyman left boot prints around the bathroom floor which was a bit annoying. It a bit off the main tourist areas so it was very noisy around the hotel. I would stay there again next time I visit. My only complaint was that wifi internet in the room, although free, was extremely slow and made working in my room difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for weekend breaks”
Reviews.Author: Georgiew14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a very busy main road which was very handy to get about and down to the main shopping streets and restaurants in minutes. Lovely large bedroom with huge beds and great space to move around. Very friendly staff at reception

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay H
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Barcelona in October and we loved it! Beautful city and plenty to do and see. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and it was in a fabulous location ( a little bit of a walk to the harbour and beach but it is really worth it). The room was larger than expected with wonderful views and the bed was incredibly comfortable and King Size! I do not know how people can fault this place and to moan about having to use the key card to put the lights on is utterly ridiculous. I would recommend this hotel and city in a heartbeat and can not wait to return! Please note that if you want to see any of the amazing architecture than get there very early, the queues in particular for the Sagrada Familia were long!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star, poor location”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDave186487
Reviews.Content: The outside of the building and reception look fine, but rooms are basic. Could not call this 4 star, but 3 star is fair. Location wise, it is quite away from the centre, and even the closest Metro is quite a walk. As I wouldn't use the Metro late at night, a walk back to the hotel after a meal at a central restaurant is quite a distance to cover. Overall it does the job, is clean, rate too high for the quality of the rooms, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Danes55
Reviews.Content: Frindly staff in reception, but very small and slow elevators. Big rooms and very modern but even on the 8 floor there were still trafic noise.Bath is more than large, but do check the shower instructions in time !! Reception ok, bar on the first floor and breakfirst was ok with fresh cooked egs as wanted. General clean and modern hotel with a good location and acces to airprt and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: Stellatravels
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in this hotel right now and am enjoying everything about my visit to Barcelona EXCEPT this hotel. From the check-in, the staff has not been very helpful. As someone who has not stayed in a hotel in Spain before, I walked into my room and could not turn on the lights. Apparently, you must insert your key card into a socket to work the light switches. It would have been great if someone told me that when I checked in...Instead I called and the hotel staff acted annoyed that I did not know this. A few minutes later, I went back to the lobby to ask a question. After waiting for 15 minutes behind one couple chatting about where to go and what to do, the front desk person asked if he could help me. I asked if they have an adapter as I forgot mine and right away just said NO. "Is there somewhere else I may find one?" I asked. "El Corte Ingles, but it is closed now." I returned to my room to use my computer on its battery. When I booted up, the "free" wireless required a username and password that must be secured at the front desk. Back down 11 floors to ask for this. "Unfortunately, our system is down." said the front desk person. "I will call when it is up." An hour later he called with the username and password, at which point it was 11 pm and I was in bed. Trying to sleep was no easy feat. The walls in this hotel are very thin and you can hear everything in the room next to you. The housekeeping staff wears heels and is up quite early moving furniture and running around making noise. The room is pretty small, though the view is nice. The bathroom is ok but bring your own soap. There is one bar for the sink and shower, and it dissolves with one shower. No washclothes and no bath mat so water drips on the floor.... I love Barcelona but am very disappointed in this hotel. Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: livetotravel1953
Reviews.Content: Clean, relatively new, and modern. Staff are polite and courteous, willing to assist. Alex of the Reception Staff, in particularly, is very accomodating and helpful. However, the floor floods everytime you shower as the shower door are not properly assembled. The door should be closing from the opposite direction. Same problem in other rooms. If Las Ramblas is important as part of your visit to Barcelona, then this hotel is not for you. It's way too far we ended up using taxis most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashaki V
Reviews.Content: First impressions was great - easy check-in combined extremely friendly staff. We stayed on the 14th floor as we requested a quiet room. It was perfect. The views were great. I could see the Gaudi from the room. The room was immaculate and spacious. Bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean. Location of the hotel was great. It was just a 10 minute bus ride from La Rambla. The area itself had great boutiques - Loewe was just next door ;) Overall, i absolutely loooooved my stay. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: elydia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel over night, the late reception was very kind and professional, the room spacious, nicely decorated and new (photos). Double windows for silence and comfort, which could still be opened for fresh air. Wet area impecable, towels new and fluffy, lots of toilettries (soup. shampoo, gel etc). The shower, with instruction manual pending at the door (!), was kind of a nerve for me though, specially at 1 a.m. ! Breakfast was excellent and quality, service and attention of all staff in the Hotel impecable. Extra wishes were dealt correctly and in a very professional way. Will come back any time!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday,amazing stay,wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Freddy M
Reviews.Content: I recently had a nice holiday in Barcelona and chose to stay at the Esperia presidente for the first time.I have stayed in many different great hotels when I travel for business but this was a leisure trip basically. The hotel was exactly what I wanted for the 2 of us. The reception was really welcoming and helpful.The even helped me carry my bags to my room.The room we were offered was so big and spacious and free internet connection.The staff was overall excellent during our 11 days there. There is also a gym and as an ex fitness trainer I can definitely say that even though the fitness area is small, there is everything you need in there to do a great work out,no doubt about it.The location is great,close to all amenities.My only problem is and why I may not go back there is its not far away from both main metro stations because I was there on holidaying and partying.I did not come to visit Barcelona because I have been there thousand of times but if you going there to visit I dont think you will mind walking back and forth.That was my only big issue and there are times We had to take a taxi.Oversall I will recommend anyone to chose to stay in this hotel unless you like me you hate waking back and forth to the metro which is about a good 10/15mns walk so if you have to do that about 4 times a day in the rush that could be a problem.Good luck to you all and thank you once to the staff for my wonderfull stay. Freddy

Reviews.Title: “Great location & amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lervold8486
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before embarking kn our cruise out of Barcelona. Actually we were booked in anothe hesperia hotel and were moved to the presidente because the water wasn't working at our hotel. The presidente is in an awesome location & has phenomenal rooms. We were actually upgraded to a suite because of our inconvenience and the room was incredible. The hotel was immaculately clean with a very helpful staff. It was located near tons of restaurants with access to anything that you could need. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean place in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice <i would go back there in a flash.”
Reviews.Author: FBETTAN
Reviews.Content: I traveled the world and had the chance to stay in some great hotels so when I booked a hotel to stay with my family for 10 days I was looking for a nice place clean, safe and good value. This is GREAT value. Very well located , 15 minutes from airport and place catalunya..in the middle of a great shopping area. Because the rooms are so well priced we took 2 rooms for us and our 2 teenagers. What a great idea. We had to rooms on a corner of the seventh floor. The service was perfect every day of our stay..We slept very well, the showers are fantastic ...the staff is professional and friendly. free WIFI in every rooms.. Go Go Go !

Reviews.Title: “The location is not central but the hotel, staff and accommodations are great”
Reviews.Author: zamfamtravel
Reviews.Content: We ended up here when our reservations at another hotel on the Ramblas fell through - it was a nightmare until they were able to find us a room here at the Herperia Presidente. This is a very nice, modern and comfortable hotel. Large rooms with King beds are extremely comfortable and even the pull outs beds were comfortable ( we were a group of six - 3 to a room). The location is a downfall, although we discovered that the tour busses, which we would normally not do, were an easy fix. We were able to go everywhere we wanted with a one or two day pass. The staff was so accommodating and helpful that we decided not to go back to the other hotel the next day but rather stay put. The breakfast offerred a nice selection of options. The recommmendations for meals, while good, was outrageously expensive. Sergio, Alex and the Carlos were exceptional and deserve our praise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: doux96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hesperia Presidente for 02 nights in July and were absolutely delighted with the standard of accommodation.Room is spotlessly clean in every area and serviced daily with tea, coffee and welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast was wonderful with a huge choice and all freshly cooked to order. The staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. I have never stayed in Hotel like this before :Very clean, very friendly, good room, comfy beds,good showers, really no complaints at all.I will definitely be staying here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Stay”
Reviews.Author: kvrn84
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Hesperia Presidente in Barcelona and it was an interesting stay. Before I tell you my experience I'll let you know about the rooms. My husband and I stayed in the Junior Suite, which compared to other hotels is not that expensive. The room is small for a suite, but the living area and bedroom was divided by sliding doors which was nice. Aside from the bed being huge and oh so comfy the rest of the room was average. The couch was old and not very comfortable, but it had a pull out bed which is good for groups. The rest of the decor was nice, but not that impressive. We had a great view of the city. Mind you, the hotel is not near the center, but long walking distance from some of the sites like Casa Piedra. The bathroom was small and there was no tub in our room. One plus for the hotel is that it provided free internet! The interesting part is that the first day we were there the maid walked into the room without knocking or making herself known. It was awkward because we were changing at the time. That was embarrassing and my husband was mad and called to complain. The day when we were leaving I was taking a shower and when I reached for my towel there was a giant cockroach climbing my towel. There are three things I have a phobia against: heights, needles, and cockroaches. I almost tripped over myself screaming trying to get out of the shower. I have gone my entire two weeks in Spain without seeing one and this was great end to my trip. Finally, the hotel prides itself on being a hotel for the business class, but has the most out of date business center. My husband went to make a copy of our tickets and he took a long time because they were operating still on Windows 95, the oldest version of Adobe, and a tiny printer that did not worked well. That was a big disappointment. One very impportant tip, if you order the Ceasar Salad you will be sorely disappointed because I ordered a Ceasar Salad and it tasted nothing like a Ceasar Salard. They put some kind blue cheese dressing and I hate blue cheese. Just don't get it, is expensive and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the hotel, but prefer something else for family”
Reviews.Author: kimhhuang
Reviews.Content: Really, there is nothing wrong this hotel. It's location is not bad, and the room was good. We stayed here before a cruise and at a different hotel after the cruise. For a family of 3, we would have liked a bigger room or a pull out sofa bed. Didn't feel comfortable keeping our window curtains open because we were literally next to apartments. You could see in their windows and they could see in yours. We had to call for a taxi when we needed it to go to the cruise to avoid walking across the street with our suitcases and young child, which costs an extra 3 euros when called to the hotel. The other hotel we stayed at, the taxi lane was right in front of the hotel. In Barcelona, there are designated areas where you can hail a cab. We always like to have a market nearby in case we need any supplies. One is located about 2 blocks away. Free wifi internet is available even in the room, but the signal is weak inside the room. It was nice that one universal adapter was available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ellijayjeff
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hesperia Presidente was by mistake but was so glad that it was made as the Presidente is a fantastic hotel.They even bumped us up to a balcony suite. What a fantastic hotel for our first night in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely confortable rooms and well situated in av Diagonal”
Reviews.Author: STEFANIA1968
Reviews.Content: Queen size bed was very confortable, room was perfect nothing to add all was perfect. Personnel very helpfull and professional. Breakfast is quite expensive (30,2 cents for two) even it was a huge and very good and fresh breakfast it was too much for every morning. Free and very fast internet connections for guests.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I would stay at again”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl19
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Hesperia Presidente for a long weekend and we were very pleased with the standards there. The rooms were modern and spotlessly clean, the breakfast was very comprehensive and the staff were friendly and welcoming at all times. All in all, a good choice and one we'd choose again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Big, modern and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: SMMSBR
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not look tasteful from the outside (especially by Barcelona standards), but our room was beautifully decorated. The size was almost twice that of the previous room we had elsewhere in Barcelona for the same price. Lots of mirrors for ladies =) The bed was super comfy. Our shower had three functionalities, and the space was huge. Staff was friendly and competent. Everybody spoke fluent English. We were able to check in at 10am. Got prompt help at 3am. Located in a safe neighborhood and near some fab restaurants and inexpensive grocery stores, the hotel is a bit far away from the metro, but there are many buses steps away (you can take buses to/from the airport too). Close the windows before you sleep if you do not want to hear the noises from the club across the street at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy0
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel before and if you can get a good deal it is really worthwhile. The rate was 119 euro per night for a double room, excluding breakfast (an additional 19 euro). The staff at check-in is friendly, although it takes a while before they have copied your passport, etc. There was free wifi internet, which I feel is a basic necessity for business travel. You get the log-in code from the front desk. The room on the 12th floor was spacious, The bed was excellent and there was even some extra space to sit and relax. There is a seperate huge shower, which once you figure out how it works is fantastic. There are plenty of guest amenities, including nail polish remover, first time I saw this in a hotel. On the downside, there was a maintenance door in the toilet that kept slamming in its locks, I fixed it in its place with a shower cap. Furthermore, the TV remote didn't work too well anymore. The windows of the rooms open to let in fresh air, which is great. Also there were plenty of power sockets to plug in smart phones, laptops and all other travel electronics. Even though the breakfast is extremely high in price, the quality is great. Good juice and excellent coffee from a Jura machine. Plenty of choices in bread, cold cuts, etc. I'm not sure if they fry eggs or not. In the surrounding streets there are plenty of bars (Berlin right across the hotel lobby) that serve good drinks and tapas. I will most likely stay here again if the prices are reasonable. Breakfast price should go down though!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: EricGu
Reviews.Content: I was staying there in February 2011 and in February 2010 for a few nights for business. This hotel is so much better than where I used to stay in Barcelona in the previous years. The rooms are clean, spacious, well arranged with a great comfortable bed. Although the location is not exactly in the center, it is convenient for me as it gives easy access to the main parts of the city. There are nice bars and restaurant around. The service is good. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient for a business trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dysphorichousewife
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in March - had all of the features required for a good trip: comfortable bed, nice shower, desk, free wifi (although it didn't work the first night) alot of electrical outlets, clean & quiet room, makeup mirror and blow dryer - all in a good location. The bar seems to close early as others have mentioned, but there are many good restaurants, bars within a block of the hotel. The hotel is also close to some wonderful stores if you have time to shop! I didn't check out the gym or business center (not even sure if they have one).

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, the bar seems to close a little early. Noisy on the front”
Reviews.Author: extracover
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, very nice staff, your room key sometimes fails, a real pain when you are on the 8th floor. I had a room facing the road which was extremely noisy on a Thursday night as people leave the establishment around the corner at 4 am ! however very nice place !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Jh_globe_trotter
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms are modern and very well maintained. Although the hotel is on a main street, the rooms are well isolated. Hotel staff was very helpful, although there were no particular requests. This hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: steefvw
Reviews.Content: Stayed in junior suite. Room was nice and spaceous. Service was disappointing though. Staff hardly understood English and weren't helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AnaVaju96
Reviews.Content: the hotel was excelent, the stuff was very nice. we had a very good time at HP

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel at a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela52
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a party of six (three couples) in this hotel. All rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were great - really large showers and plenty of hot water.Bed were enormous and very comfortable. Each couple was more than satisfied with their room. The staff were friendly and polite, very helpful in giving directions as the hotel is not on the main tourist trail. Breakfast was good but wasn't madly keen on eating there at other times. We did have snacks but found them pricey. The bar is nice but quiet. All in all we had a wonderful time at the Hesperia and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel with the best shower I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: bobknight113
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel in a out of the city centre location. A very quiet hotel with very spacious rooms and excellent facilities. The bed was huge and the bathroom amazing with one of the best showers I have ever seen. Buffet breakfast is superb - lots of choice and all very fresh and deliciously presented. Staff all very helpful and incredibly polite. Food at other times is not great - but there are so many great eating places nearby there is no need to eat in th hotel. We got a great offer from travelzoo so the value was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay”
Reviews.Author: Raskolnikov65
Reviews.Content: This is an awful hotel- out in the sticks in a sad 70's/80's building on a busy road. The hotel staff is rude and unpleasant, the rooms are small and overpriced. The decor inside the building picks up somewhat but still reeks of pseudo-chic with smelly carpets. Arrived to find cockroach at the door and some creature on the bed. Stayed in Loews hotel before which were nice but this one is terrible- the loewest of the loew! We were greeted by Alva and Zoe at the front desk, typical big hotel hierarchy with questions to Zoe always being passed on to Alva- why not deal with Alva directly rather than through her minion . Ultimately were promised a Junior Suite but room ended up being very basic - is this the junior suite? If it is hate to see the standard room!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Hesperia Presidente Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: I have a very good overall visit at the Hesperia Presidente in Barcelona. It's a good location, not perfect. But Barcelona has an excellent bus/Metro system. Buses are right outside the door, and you can buy day passes for less than 6 Euros which gives you unlimited rides. The hotel is clean, but the hotel room carpets are out-of-date. The TV screen is LCD but smallish. Adequate room working space and best of all, FREE wifi. They have a good gym but not great, just no ellyptical trainer. You'll be able to get in a workout, plus good free weights. The Solarium outside is very nice. Best of all was the front desk service. I had numerous questions about Barcelona and they were very helpful. Plus, there's a Starbucks 30 meters away ! So, no need to spend 15 Euros for breakfast in the hotel. Coffee is better down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JakieJr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and i think it's fantastic for those who went to Barcelona in business. It's not a "romantic" hotel. It's very well located in Diagonal, the business center. Not close to the main touristic attractions, it's a short taxi ride to the center. The metro station is far. You can find some restaurants near the hotel. The staff is kind and helpfuk, breakfast is enough, wireless for free. The room is modern and confortable, with all the facilities. I've been in Barcelona a lot of times and i think this is one the best hotels for the value. I'm sure i'll come again

Reviews.Title: “Another Term for Presidente”
Reviews.Author: AdrenalineOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from july 14 -20, 2009. I believe we were on the 9th floor, which was sweet because it is the floor that has a sundeck/balcony (you'll see the area if you see a pic of the hotel). The balcony offers a pretty decent view down the street; I used it to relax with a drink at night. Our room was excellent except for our view, which overlooked the top of other buildings. The room had a safe, which was great when heading to the beach. The bed was super comfortable. The shower was the real downfall because it had no door/curtain so water tend to spash onto the floor; oh well, water dries up. The room had a mini fridge, which we used to store food and beverages. The location is in a safe area but not that close to most attractions. However, you can easily take the bus across the street to the metro, which takes you to all major areas; that being said, to and from the airport, jump on the metro and take a bus. Metro is easy and has AC. All the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. I would not recommend the breakfast because it is quite pricey. I would definitely stay here again. Had a great experience with the Hotel and of course with Barcelona. I will definitely return to Barcelona with a tour around Spain. My only regret when I was in Barcelona was not take a ferry to the Balearic Islands or a bus up the coast, which both looks so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: crazy4nature
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights last February. The Front Desk staff was friendly and extremely helpful. This is a modern hotel with all the basic amenities for business travelers and some nice extras. My room was beautiful, specially the bathroom. The location is not within walking distance to the main tourist attractions but these can be reached in a short taxi ride. Overall I had a good experience and will return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jpgjpg
Reviews.Content: I loved Hesperia Hotels! What a group... now it belong to NH Hotels... The Hesperia Hotels are very good hotels an I've stayed in some of them in Spain: Madrid, Coruña, San Sebastian, Zaragoza, ... This 4 stars hotel in located in the main street (Diagonal), 15 min walking to Ramblas. Nice bedrooms, flat TV, large king size beds, beautifull bathrooms, very confortable, wifi internet for free, well decorated, business friendly. Nice breakfast (I've had others better in other Hesperias...). Good staff. Negative: don't have a parking lot (they recomend a public one 2 min walk - 23 euros per day).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great rooms & friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lhallowes
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a couple of nights here. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff were able to help us with any questions we had. It is quite a long walk from the central city but is only a 10 minute walk away from the nearest metro station.

Reviews.Title: “recommended this hotel but a long walk to the central”
Reviews.Author: c0zyc0rner
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 days 2 nights, very good, clean and a very spacious room. Staffs there are very helpful, only one thing that I need to consider next time was the location. The hotel is on diagonal, but it is not as the writer said 15 mins walk to Las Ramble. There is not metro nearby, but you can take a bus EUR$1.3 to the middle of the diagonal, and then walk straight to the central. If you don;t spend EUR$1.3 then it is a long walk. We are young couple, if you take your parents, or a senior with you, do not walk. Take a taxi is only EUR$5. After a few times walking tour, I decide to take a taxi from central to the hotel. Pls note, it is not a walking distance to central. When we go to the airport, the easiest way is take a taxi. There is a Pizza restaurant around the hotel corner, very good pizza and pasta, if I don't stay in this hotel next time, I will take a taxi and go back to this restaurant. Free inter-net as well!

Reviews.Title: “Going Back, that's how good it was!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBigEasy_London
Reviews.Content: No idea why some people on here are putting this hotel down. Stayed there for two nights after taking my wife there for her birthday, and we had a wonderful stay. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone!!! Going back there in April 2010...For my birthday!!!

Reviews.Title: “No way 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Karbaby
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Hesperia Presidente based on reviews read. What a mistake. Far from a 4 star hotel. Room was very small, the carpeting was so filthy, I we wouldn't walk on it in our bare feet. Furniture in lobby and in room warn out. Windows in area of elevators hadn't been washed recently. Breakfast was not worth what we were charged. When I booked the room, I received a total for the two nights. When we checked out, it was broke down into 92 euros for one night and 155 euros for the second. Not worth it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding venue for business & tourist”
Reviews.Author: kendavies
Reviews.Content: Superb, clean, high spec bedrooms, and conference facilties. at very reasonable value. Outstanding modern hotel, would highly recommend. 15/20 minutes walk from Ramblas in smart part of town. Definitely will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Research Paid Off!”
Reviews.Author: midpengirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to this hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised. The small modern lobby was very clean and neat. During the entire stay, we encountered very friendly employees that went out of their way to help us enjoy our short stay in Barcelona. We arrived to the hotel around 9:00am and were immediately able to check in, which was fantastic as we had been traveling for over 16 hours. The room was more than adequate for the 3 of us and I just loved the bathroom and shower! The free WiFi was great for us to get our last fix in before going on our cruise. The front desk agent helped us make dinner reservations and also told us where a great nightclub and bars were very close to the hotel. The Sutton Nightclub was really fun after 2am. The hotel is on the Diagonal which is about a 7 euro taxi trip to Las Ramblas (we were traveling with my older aunt so she didn't want to take public transportation). There are great places for breakfast and snacks very close to the hotel. If you go out the front, cross to your right and go up that street, I wish I could remember the name of the place! All in all, we had a great experience in the hotel, too bad we didn't sleep much!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, beautiful hotel which offered so much more than I expected. Cozy, quiet and clean. It included free wifi access (code given in the lobby upon check in). I stayed here because of a weekend deal which included 1 free night (I stayed for 3 nights). Pros: In the middle of Avinguda Diagonal which is a popular shopping destination. From 5-minute walking distance to the Bus Turistic stop (2 blocks), Passeig de Gracia (5 blocks). The room was big. Cons: If you plan on using the metro a lot, stay in a hotel that's closer to a station. The closest metro stops are Diagonal (5 blocks away or a 10-15 minute walk) and Hospital Clinic (which is even farther). The hotel is not exactly in the middle of all the 'action' but it's a good place to relax in a non-touristic neighborhood where you will find more locals than tourists. I recommend taking the Bus Touristic double decker (tickets sold in the hotel reception) which has around 3 lines and around 50 stops.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round choice”
Reviews.Author: Scousie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hesperia Presidente in May for 3 nights and had a pleasant stay. We chose the hotel due to the price (68 euros per night through hotelbook.com) which was a lot less at the time than most other hotels. It took some time to book us in (the reception always seemed to be busy) and we were given a room on the 14th floor. Overall the room was adequate in size, not tiny but not massive either. The bathroom was a bit strange and didn't give much privacy but the shower was interesting with a window that opened giving views over the Sagrada while you were in the shower! The beds were quite big and very comfortable - the only downside was that we never managed to get the aircon to work so it could get a bit warm. The hotel is located right on the Diagonal - 10 minutes walk to the Diagonal metro station and about 5 mins walk to the nearest Touristic Bus stop which is a blue and red line interchange (turn right out of the hotel and its on the roundabout). There are ordinary bus stops right outside the hotel which take you to the Nou Camp and into the centre. About 2 blocks down there is a bus which can take you straight to the Estacion Nord Bus Station where you can pick up the Barcelona Bus if you want to travel to Girona Airport for a Ryanair connection (if you do this make sure you allow plenty of time for the bus - our bus was full 10 minutes before the departure time and they only run once an hour! ) - a taxi cost us 15 euros. A T-10 ticket is really good value and allows 10 trips on the bus or metro for 7 euros. I much prefered this location to Las Ramblas - there were some really nice restaurants close by that were reasonably priced and the whole area felt very safe and clean. I would stay here again if the price was right but next time I'd probably look for a hotel a bit nearer to the Diagonal metro station first.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CamdenTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent a romantic weekend with my girlfriend in this hotel, and it was perfect! I booked this on Lastminute.com as a "Top Secret" deal, we paid a total of 108 Euros for two nights, which seemed very cheap for a 4 star hotel. We were offered an upgrade to a suite for an additional 30 Euros per night. To be honest, the rooms seem to be large anyway, so I am not sure whether this was worth it. We did not eat there (breakfast was not included in the price). The hotel exceeded my expectationsm, here are the reasons: - it provides everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel, but has some character, which all the large chains lack. - good, friendly service - Rooms are large (not just the suite). - the showers are great!!! - we had a view over the city and the sea (on the sixth floor, if I remember right) - I liked the location. Full of good shops (fashion, interior design, etc), very upmarket. I didn't mind the 20 minutes walk to Plaza Catalunya. There were a couple of nice cafes in the streets around the hotel. I guess the only downside was that it didn't have a swimming pool. I thoroughly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: JonNL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is slightly out of the center. To get to Catalunya Square you'll need to take a subway (10 minutes walk away). Or you can walk all the way, about half an hour. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities. Cafe Berlin on the corner across the road is a cool place for a drink in the evening. Nice spacious modern room with excellent beds but nothing special for this segment. The bathroom was a bit strange: there is a glass wall between the shower and the bedroom. Luckily my friend and I are not shy ;-) That said, the shower was excellent. The room had a nice roof patio/balcony with a view of the city. The free pillow service is a nice touch - you can order different types of pillow. There was no free wi-fi reception in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: Very good modern room, large (by Barcelona standards) and clean, free internet, nice shower, excellent staff (friendly and knowledgeable), this hotel is recommended. The location is not very central but if you don't mind walking to the Diagonal station approx. 10 minutes, you can get anywhere. The Diagonal being one of the busiest strees in Barcelona, the noise from outside is quite bad but the double-pane windows help keeping it to acceptable levels. Very convenient to get to the airport (approx. 20 euro depending on the traffic). Close by is a buffet restaurant called Moncho with touristic prices for a eat-as-much-as-you -ike decent food (although there are many better choices in Barcelona if you are not starving or love buffets especially). Was just annoyed that they overcharged one water, but that was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JREV-ODE
Reviews.Content: As I already mentioned in the title, a very nice hotel (****). Staff was correct, friendly and helpfull. Reception, elevators, corridors, restaurant... and the room were very clean. The room was not very big, but was very ok, stylisch, 'open' bathroom, very good shower and cleaned (daily of course) very good. A nice kingsize bed (as we asked for). The room was not located near the street (as we asked for), because we were very afraid of outside-noise. During the first night we were awake a few times because of the neighbours coming in late and leaving early and 'doing something' in between (there are always people who really think they're the only guests in a hotel !). Breakfast was outstanding (only had better once before!). The hotel is located along a busy street, an avenue, with a lot of palm trees (nice), just outside the touristic area, lots of bars, resto's, cafés ... between the Catalonian people. Closest 'metro' stations are Diagonal and Hospital Clinic, both 10-15min walk. Once you're on the 'metro' it will bring you everywhere (in Barcelona ;-). If I have the opportunity to go again, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Que encantada!”
Reviews.Author: TessM
Reviews.Content: I was only looking for a hotel that wasn't too far away from the University of Barcelona (half an hour walk) at a good price. I wasn't expecting a lovely hotel, but it was! My room was huge, the staff at the hotel was incredibly helpful, the neighborhood was nice and I couldn't be happier. It's a bit of a distance from the center of town - but that actually made me happier.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish rooms, modern, good location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: JatandGst
Reviews.Content: Found this special offer of 3nights for the price of 2nights during our stay in August 2008, excellent value for the quality provided. Although predominently a business hotel well situated in a quiet area on Diagonal Ave in central Barcelona. Just a couple of blocks from the nearest metro, within 20mins walk of Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. Whilst we loved the buzz of Las Ramblas we were very pleased not to be staying in a hotel in the middle of all the bustle. The rooms are modern and very well appointed, with efficient friendly service. Did not eat at the hotel as there are several tapas bars, cafes etc within easy reach of the hotel. Would recommend, especially if there are deals available.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ireland9
Reviews.Content: Recently spent three nights in the Hesperia Presidente. It is very nice and modern. Our room was quite big and absolutely spotless. Room service were very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was a bit strange. The shower is partly visible from the room as only some of the glass is frosted - worth knowing in advance if you are travelling with a friend or colleague. Also the toilet door doesn't shut and lock - you just push it closed as it is a big sheet of frosted glass though it is private unlike the shower! It is a bit away from the main tourist attractions so if you want to stay in the heart of Barcelona this is not the place for you. Having said that, it is very good value for a 4* hotel and is only about 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round choice”
Reviews.Author: turbovoyager
Reviews.Content: All round good city break hotel. Don't expect any Spanish flavours in the interior....quite plush for for the cost per night, and looks newly refurbed throughout. About 10-15min reasonably paced walk to the Old Town and The Ramblas. About 20-25mins to the beach/marina. However it should only cost about €10 in a taxi. If possible request one of the top floors facing towards the Med, as will give a good view. Gym only had only 3-4 machines in it, and there isn't a pool. There is a small sun terrace...but if this is what you are after, you are much better off getting a hotel near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: stromkr
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay. We took a trip during a hot week in august, the city was brimming with turists - but the room had AC, the shower great and the bed comfy. A little out of the way, but that suited us nicely. There were a couple of nice restaurants nearby, the tourist bus stopped a short walk away and subway stations was nearby. The staff was helpful, although they weren't too good in English. All in all - a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Room is small, bed is comfortable, shower is great, no pool”
Reviews.Author: Mousers
Reviews.Content: Hotel front desk staffs are just ok, I've seen friendlier ones. The room is very small but the bed is very comfortable. The shower is awesome, just that the door doesn't close properly. There is no pool in the hotel, they have a small patio on the 9th floor. Room was clean. The hotel is at the shopping district in uptown - modern part of town. It's away from the busy La Ramblas. There are lots of name brand shops near by. Make sure you visit the close by Catalunya Avenue. There are a lot of shops, and restaurants. The front desk can provide you a free map. If you want to have free internet, visit the near by Pans (sandwich place), they provide free internet service. We prefer this hotel than the crowded La Ramblas area. At least we didn't have to worry about pick pockets as much there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: fi0naS
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this amazing hotel, friendly and very helpful staff. Quality is unbeatable and flawless, no doubt will stay again. Room is very clean, modern and tidy. Best hotel to rest after a long day of walking and exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prospero1b
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Presidente on business. This is a modern, high-rise hotel in the prime business area of Barcelona, and as such is very well situated. The hotel appears to have been recently refurbished, with stone tile floors and limestone clad walls. Check-in was very quick and efficient, and staff very friendly indeed. Bedroom was high quality, with an enormous, king-size bed and quality furniture. The air-con fan was working, but not pumping cooled air, so the room was consequently a bit stuffy. The bathroom had high quality toiletries and plenty of towels. There was a separate shower – no bathtub, but the best, most powerful shower I have ever experienced. Breakfast was very good, and plentiful. The hotel was exceptionally clean and housekeeping excellent. This is a very good business hotel and I recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roach0909
Reviews.Content: I loved the modern, contemporary decor of the hotel....especially the bathrooms---I loved the large stand-in shower with the large shower head (great water pressure!) and massage jets....very relaxing after a long day of sightseeing!...I also loved the ultra-comfy king bed. I was even impressed by the complementary toiletries that the hotel provided, which even included: a hairbrush, shoeshine, razor, toothbrush, toothpaste etc... The hotel was a little far from the action in Barcelona, but I didn't mind; the hotel location was in an upscale neighboorhood on a nice, tree-lined street, and is close to transit. I would definately stay here again if I return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Slightly out of the main areas”
Reviews.Author: glitterkitten
Reviews.Content: Date: October 2007 Reviewed by: Jayne Aldred Stayed in this lovely hotel for 3 nights with my husband and a couple of friends. The hotel was very clean both in the room and reception areas etc. The room had THE most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in, and we had 3 great nights sleep - the bath was a bit dark but you don't live in the bath. Staff were very helpful giving us advice on tourist buses, taxis etc. We didn't use the bar or restaurant so I can't coment on those but they looked fine. Overall the hotel is very nice but is in the business district of Barcelona and is a little out of the main areas, if I was staying again I would look for a hotel in either the Port area or Baria Gothic area as both are good areas and very central. Watch out on the Las Ramblas area, by day its a pick pockets paradise and by night it becomes very seedy with lots of "ladies of the night" looking for business. The tourist buses are a great way of seeing everything in a weekend but they can get very busy. We read how Barcelona is one of the most expensive cities, but we thought it was great value for money, if you stay off the main tourist areas. A most enjoyable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: OAPRomford_Essex
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay in this extremely comfortable and well-run hotel. Although the rooms were not large, they had everything you could require for a relaxing stay. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and language was not a barrier. We particularly liked the comfortable bar and lounge area with it's very attentive staff. The location of the hotel was very convenient, with metro stations within a reasonable walking distance. If you don't mind a longer walk, many attractions were within easy reach on foot. If booking this hotel, we would strongly advise that you request a room on a high floor, as the views across the city are wonderful, and there is no problem with noise from the busy road. Another tip is to cross the Diagonal to a small cafe named TEO for breakfast. Their charges are very good and offer a great breakfast at a 1/3 price of the hotel's one. TEO offers an excellent range of value for money food with good and efficient service and will prepare your breakfast irrespective of whether it appears on their menu or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravler5
Reviews.Content: A classy hotel with spacious rooms. Modern, clean and comfortable. Good beds and pillows. Very friendly staff, good English. Great showers with 3 setings (normal overhead, wall jets and hand spray). Quiet neighborhood with good restaurants nearby. Negatives: no subway station nearby, the hotel breakfast only offers a buffet at 17 euros per person, and one of our group rooms had a bathroom with a see-through (opaque) window into the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Tottie2006
Reviews.Content: Given the great reviews the hotel has got by previous guests, I was expecting to be wowed by the Hesperia Presidente but there were a few niggling issues that made my 4 night stay there just average. Firstly, when booking directly with the hotel, the reservations lady was very reluctant to send me email confirmation and didn't ask for a credit card number to guarantee the booking. I booked at very short notice (the night before my arrival) so really wanted something from the hotel in writing before I left the UK. I never got my email but I did eventually (after 3 calls to chase it up) get a reservation number. The room was fine, perfectly adequate, if a little small. It was generally clean, apart from a few hairs on the bathroom floor and a rather fusty smell in the toilet cubicle. Although it was a non-smoking room, I have a sneaking suspicion that it had been occupied by smokers quite recently. On the plus side, the bed (or should I say beds - two large singles pushed together) were really comfortable and ensured a very good night's sleep. The staff was pleasant enough, although not overly welcoming. The bar is nicely laid out, although for 2 nights running we were the only 2 people in it. One thing that I did think was very cheeky was the fact that, despite offering 2 computers for guests' use in the business centre, I was asked to pay €5 for half an hour's usage. This should be free of charge. The location of the hotel is very practical and there are several decent eateries close by. There is a Starbucks just around the corner (not that you necessarily go to Barcelona to go to Starbucks, but it is a quick and easy breakfast option...) and in the basement of the nearly El Corte Ingles is a well-stocked supermarket. We went to a restaurant called Daps which was good value, served tasty food and had a lively atmosphere (just opposite El Corte Ingles). All in all, the hotel provided us with a good base to explore Barcelona. It could have been better but in general it was perfectly satisfactory.

HotelInfo.Name: Hesperia Presidente
HotelInfo.Address: Avda Diagonal 570, 08021 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Tryp Presidente Hotel)
